TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit BorderGapMaskConverter extends System.Object implements class System.Windows.Data.IMultiValueConverter

Docs.summary: Represents a converter that converts the dimensions of a control into a .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Media.VisualBrush> created by this converter applies an <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.OpacityMask%2A> to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Border> of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GroupBox> so that it does not appear in the area defined for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.HeaderedContentControl.Header%2A> of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GroupBox>.

Docs.param: An array of three numbers that represent the control parameters.
The width of the visible line to the left of the in the .
Docs.summary: Creates a that draws the border for a control.
Docs.returns: A that draws the border around a control that includes a gap for the content.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The three numbers that are in the `values` parameter represent the following <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GroupBox> control parameters:
- The width of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GroupBox> <xref:System.Windows.Controls.HeaderedContentControl.Header%2A> content.
- The width of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GroupBox> control.
- The height of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GroupBox> control.
The following illustration provides a graphical representation of the `values` parameter.
![A GroupBox and the values for the Convert method](~/add/media/bordergapmaskconverterillustration.png "A GroupBox and the valiues for the Convert method")
